intro: Viola tricolor subsp. polychroma, commonly known as the purple viola, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped lobes and produces showy flowers in shades of violet, purple, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along streams. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
